org.dataconservancy.dcs.util

Class UriUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dataconservancy.dcs.util.UriUtility

    A utility class for doing URI-related work for verification and uniform File handling

      • isHttpUrl

        public static boolean isHttpUrl(URI toCheck)
        Determine if a URL is a URL using HTTP or HTTPS protocols
        Parameters:
        toCheck - The URI to check
        Returns:
        true if the URI is a URL with a non-empty host and uses either the http or https protocol

        public static boolean isResolvable(URI toCheck)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • makeFileUriString

        public static URI makeFileUriString(File file,
                                    File basedir)
                             throws URISyntaxException
        Create a URI string for a file, ensuring that it has 3 slashes to meet File URL specifications
        Parameters:
        file - The file to check. This doesn't have to be an actual existing file
        basedir - The directory to make the file URI relative to. Can be null. If not null, the basedir must be in the path of the file parameter, or an exception will be thrown
        Returns:
        A string representing the URI to the file on the local disk.
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException - if there is an error in the URI syntax

      • makeBagUriString

        public static URI makeBagUriString(File file,
                                   File basedir)
                            throws URISyntaxException
        Create a URI string for a file in a BagIt bag,
        Parameters:
        file - The file to check. This doesn't have to be an actual existing file
        basedir - The directory to make the file URI relative to. Can be null. If not null, the basedir must be in the path of the file parameter, or an exception will be thrown
        Returns:
        A string representing the URI to the file on the local disk.
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException - if there is an error in the URI syntax

      • resolveBagUri

        public static Path resolveBagUri(Path baseDir,
                                 URI bagUri)
        Resolves the supplied bag:// URI against a platform-specific base directory. This method is used to resolve resources in a bag to a platform-specific Path used by the caller to access the content of the resource.

        Example usage: Given a bag that contains a resource identified by the URI bag://my-bag/data/bar, and the bag has been exploded into the directory /tmp/foo/my-bag (where the bag payload directory is located at /tmp/foo/my-bag/data) then the base directory of the bag is /tmp/foo. If the caller wishes to resolve the URI bag://my-bag/data/bar, they would invoke this method: 

             Path result = UriUtility.resolveBagUri(Paths.get("/tmp/foo"), new URI("bag://my-bag/data/bar"));
     assert Paths.get("/tmp/foo/my-bag/data/bar").equals(result);

        The base directory does not need to exist. This implementation will normalize the supplied directory.

        The bag:// URI is converted to a path by concatenating the authority portion of the URI with the path portion.

        If the supplied bagUri is not a URI with the bag scheme, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        baseDir - the base directory that contains the bag
        bagUri - a URI identifying a resource in a bag
        Returns:
        a platform-specific Path, used to access the contents of the resource identified by bagUri
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied bagUri is null or empty, if baseDir is null, if bagUri does not have scheme bag
        RuntimeException - if the supplied base directory cannot be normalized

      • isBagUri

        public static boolean isBagUri(URI uri)
        Returns true if the scheme for uri is equal to bag, otherwise it returns false.
        Parameters:
        uri - the uri
        Returns:
        true if the scheme of the URI equals bag
